content:
TITLE: Initializing Langfuse Python Client
DESCRIPTION: Creates a new instance of the FernLangfuse client with the necessary configuration parameters.
SOURCE: https://github.com/langfuse/langfuse-python/blob/main/langfuse/api/reference.md#2025-04-22_snippet_33

LANGUAGE: python
CODE:
```
from langfuse.client import FernLangfuse

client = FernLangfuse(
    x_langfuse_sdk_name="YOUR_X_LANGFUSE_SDK_NAME",
    x_langfuse_sdk_version="YOUR_X_LANGFUSE_SDK_VERSION",
    x_langfuse_public_key="YOUR_X_LANGFUSE_PUBLIC_KEY",
    username="YOUR_USERNAME",
    password="YOUR_PASSWORD",
    base_url="https://yourhost.com/path/to/api",
)
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Installing Langfuse Python Library
DESCRIPTION: Command to install the Langfuse Python library using pip package manager.
SOURCE: https://github.com/langfuse/langfuse-python/blob/main/langfuse/api/README.md#2025-04-22_snippet_0

LANGUAGE: shell
CODE:
```
pip install langfuse
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Handling Langfuse API Errors
DESCRIPTION: Example of catching and handling Langfuse API errors using try/except blocks. This demonstrates how to access the status code and error body when the API returns a non-success status code.
SOURCE: https://github.com/langfuse/langfuse-python/blob/main/langfuse/api/README.md#2025-04-22_snippet_3

LANGUAGE: python
CODE:
```
from .api_error import ApiError

try:
    client.annotation_queues.create_queue_item(...)
except ApiError as e:
    print(e.status_code)
    print(e.body)
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Installing Langfuse Python SDK
DESCRIPTION: Command to install the Langfuse Python package using pip package manager. Note that version 2 was released on December 17, 2023, with breaking changes from v1.
SOURCE: https://github.com/langfuse/langfuse-python/blob/main/README.md#2025-04-22_snippet_0

LANGUAGE: bash
CODE:
```
pip install langfuse
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Using Langfuse Async Python Client
DESCRIPTION: Demonstration of the asynchronous Langfuse client for making non-blocking API calls. This example shows how to set up and use the async client with Python's asyncio framework.
SOURCE: https://github.com/langfuse/langfuse-python/blob/main/langfuse/api/README.md#2025-04-22_snippet_2

LANGUAGE: python
CODE:
```
import asyncio

from langfuse import AnnotationQueueObjectType, CreateAnnotationQueueItemRequest
from langfuse.client import AsyncFernLangfuse

client = AsyncFernLangfuse(
    x_langfuse_sdk_name="YOUR_X_LANGFUSE_SDK_NAME",
    x_langfuse_sdk_version="YOUR_X_LANGFUSE_SDK_VERSION",
    x_langfuse_public_key="YOUR_X_LANGFUSE_PUBLIC_KEY",
    username="YOUR_USERNAME",
    password="YOUR_PASSWORD",
    base_url="https://yourhost.com/path/to/api",
)


async def main() -> None:
    await client.annotation_queues.create_queue_item(
        queue_id="queueId",
        request=CreateAnnotationQueueItemRequest(
            object_id="objectId",
            object_type=AnnotationQueueObjectType.TRACE,
        ),
    )


asyncio.run(main())
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Using Langfuse Python Client
DESCRIPTION: Example of initializing and using the Langfuse Python client to create a queue item in an annotation queue. This demonstrates the basic synchronous client configuration and API interaction.
SOURCE: https://github.com/langfuse/langfuse-python/blob/main/langfuse/api/README.md#2025-04-22_snippet_1

LANGUAGE: python
CODE:
```
from langfuse import AnnotationQueueObjectType, CreateAnnotationQueueItemRequest
from langfuse.client import FernLangfuse

client = FernLangfuse(
    x_langfuse_sdk_name="YOUR_X_LANGFUSE_SDK_NAME",
    x_langfuse_sdk_version="YOUR_X_LANGFUSE_SDK_VERSION",
    x_langfuse_public_key="YOUR_X_LANGFUSE_PUBLIC_KEY",
    username="YOUR_USERNAME",
    password="YOUR_PASSWORD",
    base_url="https://yourhost.com/path/to/api",
)
client.annotation_queues.create_queue_item(
    queue_id="queueId",
    request=CreateAnnotationQueueItemRequest(
        object_id="objectId",
        object_type=AnnotationQueueObjectType.TRACE,
    ),
)
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Deleting Multiple Traces with Langfuse Python Client
DESCRIPTION: This snippet demonstrates how to delete multiple traces at once using the Langfuse Python client. It requires initializing the client with authentication details and then calling the delete_multiple method with a list of trace IDs.
SOURCE: https://github.com/langfuse/langfuse-python/blob/main/langfuse/api/reference.md#2025-04-22_snippet_51

LANGUAGE: python
CODE:
```
from langfuse.client import FernLangfuse

client = FernLangfuse(
    x_langfuse_sdk_name="YOUR_X_LANGFUSE_SDK_NAME",
    x_langfuse_sdk_version="YOUR_X_LANGFUSE_SDK_VERSION",
    x_langfuse_public_key="YOUR_X_LANGFUSE_PUBLIC_KEY",
    username="YOUR_USERNAME",
    password="YOUR_PASSWORD",
    base_url="https://yourhost.com/path/to/api",
)
client.trace.delete_multiple(
    trace_ids=["traceIds", "traceIds"],
)
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Initializing Langfuse Python Client
DESCRIPTION: This snippet demonstrates how to initialize the Langfuse Python client with configuration parameters. It includes setting up the client with SDK name, version, public key, username, password, and base URL.
SOURCE: https://github.com/langfuse/langfuse-python/blob/main/langfuse/api/reference.md#2025-04-22_snippet_8

LANGUAGE: python
CODE:
```
from langfuse.client import FernLangfuse

client = FernLangfuse(
    x_langfuse_sdk_name="YOUR_X_LANGFUSE_SDK_NAME",
    x_langfuse_sdk_version="YOUR_X_LANGFUSE_SDK_VERSION",
    x_langfuse_public_key="YOUR_X_LANGFUSE_PUBLIC_KEY",
    username="YOUR_USERNAME",
    password="YOUR_PASSWORD",
    base_url="https://yourhost.com/path/to/api",
)
client.comments.get()
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Getting Project Information
DESCRIPTION: Retrieves information about the project associated with the API key.
SOURCE: https://github.com/langfuse/langfuse-python/blob/main/langfuse/api/reference.md#2025-04-22_snippet_34

LANGUAGE: python
CODE:
```
client.projects.get()
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Batch Ingestion of Tracing Events
DESCRIPTION: Example showing how to perform batch ingestion of tracing events with score creation
SOURCE: https://github.com/langfuse/langfuse-python/blob/main/langfuse/api/reference.md#2025-04-22_snippet_22

LANGUAGE: python
CODE:
```
from langfuse import IngestionEvent_ScoreCreate, ScoreBody
from langfuse.client import FernLangfuse

client = FernLangfuse(
    x_langfuse_sdk_name="YOUR_X_LANGFUSE_SDK_NAME",
    x_langfuse_sdk_version="YOUR_X_LANGFUSE_SDK_VERSION",
    x_langfuse_public_key="YOUR_X_LANGFUSE_PUBLIC_KEY",
    username="YOUR_USERNAME",
    password="YOUR_PASSWORD",
    base_url="https://yourhost.com/path/to/api",
)
client.ingestion.batch(
    batch=[
        IngestionEvent_ScoreCreate(
            id="abcdef-1234-5678-90ab",
            timestamp="2022-01-01T00:00:00.000Z",
            body=ScoreBody(
                id="abcdef-1234-5678-90ab",
                trace_id="1234-5678-90ab-cdef",
                name="My Score",
                value=0.9,
                environment="default",
            ),
        )
    ],
)
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Getting Model Details in Langfuse Python SDK
DESCRIPTION: Retrieves detailed information about a specific model by its ID. The client needs to be initialized with proper authentication credentials.
SOURCE: https://github.com/langfuse/langfuse-python/blob/main/langfuse/api/reference.md#2025-04-22_snippet_29

LANGUAGE: python
CODE:
```
from langfuse.client import FernLangfuse

client = FernLangfuse(
    x_langfuse_sdk_name="YOUR_X_LANGFUSE_SDK_NAME",
    x_langfuse_sdk_version="YOUR_X_LANGFUSE_SDK_VERSION",
    x_langfuse_public_key="YOUR_X_LANGFUSE_PUBLIC_KEY",
    username="YOUR_USERNAME",
    password="YOUR_PASSWORD",
    base_url="https://yourhost.com/path/to/api",
)
client.models.get(
    id="id",
)
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Listing Traces with Langfuse Python Client
DESCRIPTION: This snippet illustrates how to list traces using the Langfuse Python client. It requires initializing the client with authentication details and then calling the list method. Various optional parameters can be used to filter and paginate the results.
SOURCE: https://github.com/langfuse/langfuse-python/blob/main/langfuse/api/reference.md#2025-04-22_snippet_50

LANGUAGE: python
CODE:
```
from langfuse.client import FernLangfuse

client = FernLangfuse(
    x_langfuse_sdk_name="YOUR_X_LANGFUSE_SDK_NAME",
    x_langfuse_sdk_version="YOUR_X_LANGFUSE_SDK_VERSION",
    x_langfuse_public_key="YOUR_X_LANGFUSE_PUBLIC_KEY",
    username="YOUR_USERNAME",
    password="YOUR_PASSWORD",
    base_url="https://yourhost.com/path/to/api",
)
client.trace.list()
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Retrieving a Specific Prompt
DESCRIPTION: Fetches a prompt by its name, with optional version or label parameters.
SOURCE: https://github.com/langfuse/langfuse-python/blob/main/langfuse/api/reference.md#2025-04-22_snippet_36

LANGUAGE: python
CODE:
```
client.prompts.get(
    prompt_name="promptName",
)
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Retrieving a Trace with Langfuse Python Client
DESCRIPTION: This snippet demonstrates how to get a specific trace using the Langfuse Python client. It requires initializing the client with authentication details and then calling the get method with a trace ID.
SOURCE: https://github.com/langfuse/langfuse-python/blob/main/langfuse/api/reference.md#2025-04-22_snippet_48

LANGUAGE: python
CODE:
```
from langfuse.client import FernLangfuse

client = FernLangfuse(
    x_langfuse_sdk_name="YOUR_X_LANGFUSE_SDK_NAME",
    x_langfuse_sdk_version="YOUR_X_LANGFUSE_SDK_VERSION",
    x_langfuse_public_key="YOUR_X_LANGFUSE_PUBLIC_KEY",
    username="YOUR_USERNAME",
    password="YOUR_PASSWORD",
    base_url="https://yourhost.com/path/to/api",
)
client.trace.get(
    trace_id="traceId",
)
```

TITLE: Getting Dataset Run Information
DESCRIPTION: Example showing how to retrieve a specific dataset run and its items using the dataset name and run name
SOURCE: https://github.com/langfuse/langfuse-python/blob/main/langfuse/api/reference.md#2025-04-22_snippet_18

LANGUAGE: python
CODE:
```
from langfuse.client import FernLangfuse

client = FernLangfuse(
    x_langfuse_sdk_name="YOUR_X_LANGFUSE_SDK_NAME",
    x_langfuse_sdk_version="YOUR_X_LANGFUSE_SDK_VERSION",
    x_langfuse_public_key="YOUR_X_LANGFUSE_PUBLIC_KEY",
    username="YOUR_USERNAME",
    password="YOUR_PASSWORD",
    base_url="https://yourhost.com/path/to/api",
)
client.datasets.get_run(
    dataset_name="datasetName",
    run_name="runName",
)
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Creating a Score with Langfuse Python Client
DESCRIPTION: Example demonstrating how to create a score in Langfuse. Requires a CreateScoreRequest object with trace ID, name, and value parameters.
SOURCE: https://github.com/langfuse/langfuse-python/blob/main/langfuse/api/reference.md#2025-04-22_snippet_42

LANGUAGE: python
CODE:
```
from langfuse import CreateScoreRequest
from langfuse.client import FernLangfuse

client = FernLangfuse(
    x_langfuse_sdk_name="YOUR_X_LANGFUSE_SDK_NAME",
    x_langfuse_sdk_version="YOUR_X_LANGFUSE_SDK_VERSION",
    x_langfuse_public_key="YOUR_X_LANGFUSE_PUBLIC_KEY",
    username="YOUR_USERNAME",
    password="YOUR_PASSWORD",
    base_url="https://yourhost.com/path/to/api",
)
client.score.create(
    request=CreateScoreRequest(
        trace_id="traceId",
        name="name",
        value=1.1,
    ),
)
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Retrieving Dataset
DESCRIPTION: This snippet illustrates how to retrieve a specific dataset by its name using the Langfuse Python client. It shows the usage of the get method in the datasets resource.
SOURCE: https://github.com/langfuse/langfuse-python/blob/main/langfuse/api/reference.md#2025-04-22_snippet_16

LANGUAGE: python
CODE:
```
from langfuse.client import FernLangfuse

client = FernLangfuse(
    x_langfuse_sdk_name="YOUR_X_LANGFUSE_SDK_NAME",
    x_langfuse_sdk_version="YOUR_X_LANGFUSE_SDK_VERSION",
    x_langfuse_public_key="YOUR_X_LANGFUSE_PUBLIC_KEY",
    username="YOUR_USERNAME",
    password="YOUR_PASSWORD",
    base_url="https://yourhost.com/path/to/api",
)
client.datasets.get(
    dataset_name="datasetName",
)
```

TITLE: Getting Observation Details in Langfuse Python SDK
DESCRIPTION: Retrieves information about a specific observation by its ID. An observation can be an event, span, or generation within the Langfuse platform.
SOURCE: https://github.com/langfuse/langfuse-python/blob/main/langfuse/api/reference.md#2025-04-22_snippet_31

LANGUAGE: python
CODE:
```
from langfuse.client import FernLangfuse

client = FernLangfuse(
    x_langfuse_sdk_name="YOUR_X_LANGFUSE_SDK_NAME",
    x_langfuse_sdk_version="YOUR_X_LANGFUSE_SDK_VERSION",
    x_langfuse_public_key="YOUR_X_LANGFUSE_PUBLIC_KEY",
    username="YOUR_USERNAME",
    password="YOUR_PASSWORD",
    base_url="https://yourhost.com/path/to/api",
)
client.observations.get(
    observation_id="observationId",
)
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Listing Datasets
DESCRIPTION: This snippet shows how to list all datasets using the Langfuse Python client. It demonstrates the usage of the list method in the datasets resource, which can be used to retrieve multiple datasets with optional pagination.
SOURCE: https://github.com/langfuse/langfuse-python/blob/main/langfuse/api/reference.md#2025-04-22_snippet_15

LANGUAGE: python
CODE:
```
from langfuse.client import FernLangfuse

client = FernLangfuse(
    x_langfuse_sdk_name="YOUR_X_LANGFUSE_SDK_NAME",
    x_langfuse_sdk_version="YOUR_X_LANGFUSE_SDK_VERSION",
    x_langfuse_public_key="YOUR_X_LANGFUSE_PUBLIC_KEY",
    username="YOUR_USERNAME",
    password="YOUR_PASSWORD",
    base_url="https://yourhost.com/path/to/api",
)
client.datasets.list()
```

TITLE: Listing Multiple Observations in Langfuse Python SDK
DESCRIPTION: Retrieves a list of observations from the Langfuse platform. This method allows fetching multiple observations in one API call.
SOURCE: https://github.com/langfuse/langfuse-python/blob/main/langfuse/api/reference.md#2025-04-22_snippet_32

LANGUAGE: python
CODE:
```
from langfuse.client import FernLangfuse

client = FernLangfuse(
    x_langfuse_sdk_name="YOUR_X_LANGFUSE_SDK_NAME",
    x_langfuse_sdk_version="YOUR_X_LANGFUSE_SDK_VERSION",
    x_langfuse_public_key="YOUR_X_LANGFUSE_PUBLIC_KEY",
    username="YOUR_USERNAME",
    password="YOUR_PASSWORD",
    base_url="https://yourhost.com/path/to/api",
)
client.observations.get_many()
```

TITLE: Creating Dataset Run Item
DESCRIPTION: This snippet demonstrates how to create a dataset run item using the Langfuse Python client. It shows the usage of the create method in the dataset_run_items resource, including the required CreateDatasetRunItemRequest object.
SOURCE: https://github.com/langfuse/langfuse-python/blob/main/langfuse/api/reference.md#2025-04-22_snippet_14

LANGUAGE: python
CODE:
```
from langfuse import CreateDatasetRunItemRequest
from langfuse.client import FernLangfuse

client = FernLangfuse(
    x_langfuse_sdk_name="YOUR_X_LANGFUSE_SDK_NAME",
    x_langfuse_sdk_version="YOUR_X_LANGFUSE_SDK_VERSION",
    x_langfuse_public_key="YOUR_X_LANGFUSE_PUBLIC_KEY",
    username="YOUR_USERNAME",
    password="YOUR_PASSWORD",
    base_url="https://yourhost.com/path/to/api",
)
client.dataset_run_items.create(
    request=CreateDatasetRunItemRequest(
        run_name="runName",
        dataset_item_id="datasetItemId",
    ),
)
```

TITLE: Fetching Daily Metrics with Langfuse Python SDK
DESCRIPTION: Retrieves daily metrics for the Langfuse project with optional filtering capabilities. Metrics can be filtered by trace name, user ID, tags, environment, and timestamp ranges.
SOURCE: https://github.com/langfuse/langfuse-python/blob/main/langfuse/api/reference.md#2025-04-22_snippet_26

LANGUAGE: python
CODE:
```
from langfuse.client import FernLangfuse

client = FernLangfuse(
    x_langfuse_sdk_name="YOUR_X_LANGFUSE_SDK_NAME",
    x_langfuse_sdk_version="YOUR_X_LANGFUSE_SDK_VERSION",
    x_langfuse_public_key="YOUR_X_LANGFUSE_PUBLIC_KEY",
    username="YOUR_USERNAME",
    password="YOUR_PASSWORD",
    base_url="https://yourhost.com/path/to/api",
)
client.metrics.daily()
```

TITLE: Listing Dataset Items
DESCRIPTION: This snippet shows how to list dataset items using the Langfuse Python client. It demonstrates the usage of the list method in the dataset_items resource, which can be used to retrieve multiple dataset items.
SOURCE: https://github.com/langfuse/langfuse-python/blob/main/langfuse/api/reference.md#2025-04-22_snippet_12

LANGUAGE: python
CODE:
```
from langfuse.client import FernLangfuse

client = FernLangfuse(
    x_langfuse_sdk_name="YOUR_X_LANGFUSE_SDK_NAME",
    x_langfuse_sdk_version="YOUR_X_LANGFUSE_SDK_VERSION",
    x_langfuse_public_key="YOUR_X_LANGFUSE_PUBLIC_KEY",
    username="YOUR_USERNAME",
    password="YOUR_PASSWORD",
    base_url="https://yourhost.com/path/to/api",
)
client.dataset_items.list()
```

TITLE: Retrieving Scores from Langfuse
DESCRIPTION: Example showing how to get a list of scores from Langfuse. The method supports multiple optional parameters for filtering results.
SOURCE: https://github.com/langfuse/langfuse-python/blob/main/langfuse/api/reference.md#2025-04-22_snippet_43

    x_langfuse_public_key="YOUR_X_LANGFUSE_PUBLIC_KEY",
    username="YOUR_USERNAME",
    password="YOUR_PASSWORD",

TITLE: Get Annotation Queue by ID in Python
DESCRIPTION: Retrieves a specific annotation queue by its unique identifier. Requires queue_id parameter and authentication credentials.
SOURCE: https://github.com/langfuse/langfuse-python/blob/main/langfuse/api/reference.md#2025-04-22_snippet_1

LANGUAGE: python
CODE:
```
from langfuse.client import FernLangfuse

client = FernLangfuse(
    x_langfuse_sdk_name="YOUR_X_LANGFUSE_SDK_NAME",
    x_langfuse_sdk_version="YOUR_X_LANGFUSE_SDK_VERSION",
    x_langfuse_public_key="YOUR_X_LANGFUSE_PUBLIC_KEY",
    username="YOUR_USERNAME",
    password="YOUR_PASSWORD",
    base_url="https://yourhost.com/path/to/api",
)
client.annotation_queues.get_queue(
    queue_id="queueId",
)
```

TITLE: Creating Dataset with Langfuse Python Client
DESCRIPTION: Example showing how to initialize the Langfuse client and create a new dataset using the CreateDatasetRequest object
SOURCE: https://github.com/langfuse/langfuse-python/blob/main/langfuse/api/reference.md#2025-04-22_snippet_17

LANGUAGE: python
CODE:
```
from langfuse import CreateDatasetRequest

client = FernLangfuse(
    x_langfuse_sdk_name="YOUR_X_LANGFUSE_SDK_NAME",
    x_langfuse_sdk_version="YOUR_X_LANGFUSE_SDK_VERSION",
    x_langfuse_public_key="YOUR_X_LANGFUSE_PUBLIC_KEY",
    username="YOUR_USERNAME",
    password="YOUR_PASSWORD",
    base_url="https://yourhost.com/path/to/api",
)
client.datasets.create(
    request=CreateDatasetRequest(
        name="name",
    ),
)
```

LANGUAGE: python

```
from langfuse.client import FernLangfuse

    x_langfuse_public_key="YOUR_X_LANGFUSE_PUBLIC_KEY",
    username="YOUR_USERNAME",
    password="YOUR_PASSWORD",
    base_url="https://yourhost.com/path/to/api",
)
client.annotation_queues.get_queue_item(
    queue_id="queueId",
    item_id="itemId",
)
```

TITLE: Creating Dataset Item
DESCRIPTION: This snippet illustrates how to create a dataset item using the Langfuse Python client. It shows the usage of the create method in the dataset_items resource, including the required CreateDatasetItemRequest object.
SOURCE: https://github.com/langfuse/langfuse-python/blob/main/langfuse/api/reference.md#2025-04-22_snippet_10

LANGUAGE: python
CODE:
```
from langfuse import CreateDatasetItemRequest
from langfuse.client import FernLangfuse

client = FernLangfuse(
    x_langfuse_sdk_name="YOUR_X_LANGFUSE_SDK_NAME",
    x_langfuse_sdk_version="YOUR_X_LANGFUSE_SDK_VERSION",
    x_langfuse_public_key="YOUR_X_LANGFUSE_PUBLIC_KEY",
    username="YOUR_USERNAME",
    password="YOUR_PASSWORD",
    base_url="https://yourhost.com/path/to/api",
)
client.dataset_items.create(
    request=CreateDatasetItemRequest(
        dataset_name="datasetName",
    ),
)
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Update Queue Item in Python
DESCRIPTION: Updates an existing annotation queue item. Requires queue_id, item_id and an UpdateAnnotationQueueItemRequest object.
SOURCE: https://github.com/langfuse/langfuse-python/blob/main/langfuse/api/reference.md#2025-04-22_snippet_5

LANGUAGE: python
CODE:
```
from langfuse import UpdateAnnotationQueueItemRequest
from langfuse.client import FernLangfuse

client = FernLangfuse(
    x_langfuse_sdk_name="YOUR_X_LANGFUSE_SDK_NAME",
    x_langfuse_sdk_version="YOUR_X_LANGFUSE_SDK_VERSION",
    x_langfuse_public_key="YOUR_X_LANGFUSE_PUBLIC_KEY",
    username="YOUR_USERNAME",
    password="YOUR_PASSWORD",
    base_url="https://yourhost.com/path/to/api",
)
client.annotation_queues.update_queue_item(
    queue_id="queueId",
    item_id="itemId",
    request=UpdateAnnotationQueueItemRequest(),
)
```

TITLE: Retrieving Dataset Item
DESCRIPTION: This snippet demonstrates how to retrieve a dataset item by its ID using the Langfuse Python client. It shows the usage of the get method in the dataset_items resource.
SOURCE: https://github.com/langfuse/langfuse-python/blob/main/langfuse/api/reference.md#2025-04-22_snippet_11

LANGUAGE: python

    username="YOUR_USERNAME",
    password="YOUR_PASSWORD",
    base_url="https://yourhost.com/path/to/api",

client.dataset_items.get(
    id="id",

```

TITLE: Running All Tests with Pytest
DESCRIPTION: Command to run all project tests with verbose output and INFO level logging using pytest.
SOURCE: https://github.com/langfuse/langfuse-python/blob/main/CONTRIBUTING.md#2025-04-22_snippet_3

LANGUAGE: bash
CODE:
```
poetry run pytest -s -v --log-cli-level=INFO
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Deleting Dataset Item
DESCRIPTION: This snippet illustrates how to delete a dataset item using the Langfuse Python client. It shows the usage of the delete method in the dataset_items resource, which permanently removes a dataset item and all its run items.
SOURCE: https://github.com/langfuse/langfuse-python/blob/main/langfuse/api/reference.md#2025-04-22_snippet_13

LANGUAGE: python
CODE:
```
from langfuse.client import FernLangfuse

client = FernLangfuse(
    x_langfuse_sdk_name="YOUR_X_LANGFUSE_SDK_NAME",
    x_langfuse_sdk_version="YOUR_X_LANGFUSE_SDK_VERSION",
    x_langfuse_public_key="YOUR_X_LANGFUSE_PUBLIC_KEY",
    username="YOUR_USERNAME",
    password="YOUR_PASSWORD",
    base_url="https://yourhost.com/path/to/api",
)
client.dataset_items.delete(
    id="id",
)
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Running Specific Tests with Pytest
DESCRIPTION: Command to run a specific test with verbose output and INFO level logging, targeting an individual test function.
SOURCE: https://github.com/langfuse/langfuse-python/blob/main/CONTRIBUTING.md#2025-04-22_snippet_4

LANGUAGE: bash
CODE:
```
poetry run pytest -s -v --log-cli-level=INFO tests/test_core_sdk.py::test_flush
```

from langfuse.client import FernLangfuse

    password="YOUR_PASSWORD",

client.datasets.get_runs(

)

TITLE: Running SDK Reference Documentation Locally
DESCRIPTION: Command to serve the SDK reference documentation locally for development and preview using pdoc.
SOURCE: https://github.com/langfuse/langfuse-python/blob/main/CONTRIBUTING.md#2025-04-22_snippet_8

poetry run pdoc --docformat google --logo "https://langfuse.com/langfuse_logo.svg" langfuse
```

from langfuse.client import FernLangfuse

    username="YOUR_USERNAME",

TITLE: Configuring PyPI Token for Poetry
DESCRIPTION: Command to configure Poetry with a PyPI API token for package publishing authentication.
SOURCE: https://github.com/langfuse/langfuse-python/blob/main/CONTRIBUTING.md#2025-04-22_snippet_5

LANGUAGE: bash
CODE:
```
poetry config pypi-token.pypi $your-api-token
```

TITLE: List Annotation Queues in Python
DESCRIPTION: Lists all annotation queues with optional pagination parameters. Requires authentication credentials and returns a paginated list of queues.
SOURCE: https://github.com/langfuse/langfuse-python/blob/main/langfuse/api/reference.md#2025-04-22_snippet_0

LANGUAGE: python
CODE:
```
from langfuse.client import FernLangfuse

client = FernLangfuse(
    x_langfuse_sdk_name="YOUR_X_LANGFUSE_SDK_NAME",
    x_langfuse_sdk_version="YOUR_X_LANGFUSE_SDK_VERSION",
    x_langfuse_public_key="YOUR_X_LANGFUSE_PUBLIC_KEY",
    username="YOUR_USERNAME",
    password="YOUR_PASSWORD",
    base_url="https://yourhost.com/path/to/api",
)
client.annotation_queues.list_queues()
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: List Queue Items in Python
DESCRIPTION: Retrieves items from a specific annotation queue with optional filtering by status and pagination. Requires queue_id parameter.
SOURCE: https://github.com/langfuse/langfuse-python/blob/main/langfuse/api/reference.md#2025-04-22_snippet_2

LANGUAGE: python
CODE:
```
from langfuse.client import FernLangfuse

client = FernLangfuse(
    x_langfuse_sdk_name="YOUR_X_LANGFUSE_SDK_NAME",
    x_langfuse_sdk_version="YOUR_X_LANGFUSE_SDK_VERSION",
    x_langfuse_public_key="YOUR_X_LANGFUSE_PUBLIC_KEY",
    username="YOUR_USERNAME",
    password="YOUR_PASSWORD",
    base_url="https://yourhost.com/path/to/api",
)
client.annotation_queues.list_queue_items(
    queue_id="queueId",
)
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Create Queue Item in Python
DESCRIPTION: Adds a new item to an annotation queue. Requires queue_id and a CreateAnnotationQueueItemRequest object with object_id and object_type.
SOURCE: https://github.com/langfuse/langfuse-python/blob/main/langfuse/api/reference.md#2025-04-22_snippet_4

LANGUAGE: python
CODE:
```
from langfuse import AnnotationQueueObjectType, CreateAnnotationQueueItemRequest
from langfuse.client import FernLangfuse

client = FernLangfuse(
    x_langfuse_sdk_name="YOUR_X_LANGFUSE_SDK_NAME",
    x_langfuse_sdk_version="YOUR_X_LANGFUSE_SDK_VERSION",
    x_langfuse_public_key="YOUR_X_LANGFUSE_PUBLIC_KEY",
    username="YOUR_USERNAME",
    password="YOUR_PASSWORD",
    base_url="https://yourhost.com/path/to/api",
)
client.annotation_queues.create_queue_item(
    queue_id="queueId",
    request=CreateAnnotationQueueItemRequest(
        object_id="objectId",
        object_type=AnnotationQueueObjectType.TRACE,
    ),
)
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Delete Queue Item in Python
DESCRIPTION: Removes an item from an annotation queue. Requires both queue_id and item_id parameters to identify the specific item to delete.
SOURCE: https://github.com/langfuse/langfuse-python/blob/main/langfuse/api/reference.md#2025-04-22_snippet_6

LANGUAGE: python
CODE:
```
from langfuse.client import FernLangfuse

client = FernLangfuse(
    x_langfuse_sdk_name="YOUR_X_LANGFUSE_SDK_NAME",
    x_langfuse_sdk_version="YOUR_X_LANGFUSE_SDK_VERSION",
    x_langfuse_public_key="YOUR_X_LANGFUSE_PUBLIC_KEY",
    username="YOUR_USERNAME",
    password="YOUR_PASSWORD",
    base_url="https://yourhost.com/path/to/api",
)
client.annotation_queues.delete_queue_item(
    queue_id="queueId",
    item_id="itemId",
)
```

TITLE: Create Comment in Python
DESCRIPTION: Creates a new comment attached to various object types (trace, observation, session, prompt). Requires a CreateCommentRequest object with project_id, object details and content.
SOURCE: https://github.com/langfuse/langfuse-python/blob/main/langfuse/api/reference.md#2025-04-22_snippet_7

LANGUAGE: python
CODE:
```
from langfuse import CreateCommentRequest
from langfuse.client import FernLangfuse

client = FernLangfuse(
    x_langfuse_sdk_name="YOUR_X_LANGFUSE_SDK_NAME",
    x_langfuse_sdk_version="YOUR_X_LANGFUSE_SDK_VERSION",
    x_langfuse_public_key="YOUR_X_LANGFUSE_PUBLIC_KEY",
    username="YOUR_USERNAME",
    password="YOUR_PASSWORD",
    base_url="https://yourhost.com/path/to/api",
)
client.comments.create(
    request=CreateCommentRequest(
        project_id="projectId",
        object_type="objectType",
        object_id="objectId",
        content="content",
    ),
)
```

from langfuse.client import FernLangfuse

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Updating Media Record
DESCRIPTION: Example showing how to patch/update a media record with new upload status and timestamp
SOURCE: https://github.com/langfuse/langfuse-python/blob/main/langfuse/api/reference.md#2025-04-22_snippet_24

LANGUAGE: python
CODE:
```
import datetime

from langfuse import PatchMediaBody
from langfuse.client import FernLangfuse

client = FernLangfuse(
    x_langfuse_sdk_name="YOUR_X_LANGFUSE_SDK_NAME",
    x_langfuse_sdk_version="YOUR_X_LANGFUSE_SDK_VERSION",
    x_langfuse_public_key="YOUR_X_LANGFUSE_PUBLIC_KEY",
    username="YOUR_USERNAME",
    password="YOUR_PASSWORD",
    base_url="https://yourhost.com/path/to/api",
)
client.media.patch(
    media_id="mediaId",
    request=PatchMediaBody(
        uploaded_at=datetime.datetime.fromisoformat(
            "2024-01-15 09:30:00+00:00",
        ),
        upload_http_status=1,
    ),
)
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Getting a Presigned Media Upload URL with Langfuse Python SDK
DESCRIPTION: Initializes the Langfuse client and requests a presigned URL for media upload. The request includes trace ID, content type, content length, and other required parameters.
SOURCE: https://github.com/langfuse/langfuse-python/blob/main/langfuse/api/reference.md#2025-04-22_snippet_25

LANGUAGE: python
CODE:
```
from langfuse import GetMediaUploadUrlRequest, MediaContentType
from langfuse.client import FernLangfuse

client = FernLangfuse(
    x_langfuse_sdk_name="YOUR_X_LANGFUSE_SDK_NAME",
    x_langfuse_sdk_version="YOUR_X_LANGFUSE_SDK_VERSION",
    x_langfuse_public_key="YOUR_X_LANGFUSE_PUBLIC_KEY",
    username="YOUR_USERNAME",
    password="YOUR_PASSWORD",
    base_url="https://yourhost.com/path/to/api",
)
client.media.get_upload_url(
    request=GetMediaUploadUrlRequest(
        trace_id="traceId",
        content_type=MediaContentType.IMAGE_PNG,
        content_length=1,
        sha_256_hash="sha256Hash",
        field="field",
    ),
)
```

TITLE: Creating a Model in Langfuse Python SDK
DESCRIPTION: Creates a new model in the Langfuse platform by specifying a model name and match pattern. This enables tracking and analysis of specific model behaviors within the platform.
SOURCE: https://github.com/langfuse/langfuse-python/blob/main/langfuse/api/reference.md#2025-04-22_snippet_27

LANGUAGE: python
CODE:
```
from langfuse import CreateModelRequest
from langfuse.client import FernLangfuse

client = FernLangfuse(
    x_langfuse_sdk_name="YOUR_X_LANGFUSE_SDK_NAME",
    x_langfuse_sdk_version="YOUR_X_LANGFUSE_SDK_VERSION",
    x_langfuse_public_key="YOUR_X_LANGFUSE_PUBLIC_KEY",
    username="YOUR_USERNAME",
    password="YOUR_PASSWORD",
    base_url="https://yourhost.com/path/to/api",
)
client.models.create(
    request=CreateModelRequest(
        model_name="modelName",
        match_pattern="matchPattern",
    ),
)
```

    x_langfuse_sdk_version="YOUR_X_LANGFUSE_SDK_VERSION",
    x_langfuse_public_key="YOUR_X_LANGFUSE_PUBLIC_KEY",
    username="YOUR_USERNAME",
    password="YOUR_PASSWORD",
    base_url="https://yourhost.com/path/to/api",
)
client.models.delete(
    id="id",
)
```

TITLE: Listing Prompts

```
client.prompts.list()

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Updating Prompt Version Labels
DESCRIPTION: Updates the labels for a specific prompt version. Requires the prompt name, version number, and new labels.
SOURCE: https://github.com/langfuse/langfuse-python/blob/main/langfuse/api/reference.md#2025-04-22_snippet_35

LANGUAGE: python
CODE:
```
client.prompt_version.update(
    name="name",
    version=1,
    new_labels=["newLabels", "newLabels"],
)
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Creating a New Prompt Version
DESCRIPTION: Creates a new version for a prompt with the given name. Requires a CreatePromptRequest object with prompt details.
SOURCE: https://github.com/langfuse/langfuse-python/blob/main/langfuse/api/reference.md#2025-04-22_snippet_38

LANGUAGE: python
CODE:
```
from langfuse import ChatMessage, CreatePromptRequest_Chat

client.prompts.create(
    request=CreatePromptRequest_Chat(
        name="name",
        prompt=[
            ChatMessage(
                role="role",
                content="content",
            ),
            ChatMessage(
                role="role",
                content="content",
            ),
        ],
    ),
)
```

TITLE: Creating a Score Configuration
DESCRIPTION: Creates a new score configuration, which defines the structure of scores. Requires a CreateScoreConfigRequest object with configuration details.
SOURCE: https://github.com/langfuse/langfuse-python/blob/main/langfuse/api/reference.md#2025-04-22_snippet_39

LANGUAGE: python
CODE:
```
from langfuse import CreateScoreConfigRequest, ScoreDataType

client.score_configs.create(
    request=CreateScoreConfigRequest(
        name="name",
        data_type=ScoreDataType.NUMERIC,
    ),
)
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Using Custom HTTP Client with Langfuse
DESCRIPTION: Example of customizing the underlying HTTP client used by Langfuse. This demonstrates how to configure proxies and transports for specific network requirements.
SOURCE: https://github.com/langfuse/langfuse-python/blob/main/langfuse/api/README.md#2025-04-22_snippet_6

LANGUAGE: python
CODE:
```
import httpx
from langfuse.client import FernLangfuse

client = FernLangfuse(
    ...,
    http_client=httpx.Client(
        proxies="http://my.test.proxy.example.com",
        transport=httpx.HTTPTransport(local_address="0.0.0.0"),
    ),
)
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Configuring API Retries in Langfuse
DESCRIPTION: Example of configuring retry behavior for Langfuse API requests. This shows how to set the maximum number of retry attempts for a specific request.
SOURCE: https://github.com/langfuse/langfuse-python/blob/main/langfuse/api/README.md#2025-04-22_snippet_4

LANGUAGE: python
CODE:
```
client.annotation_queues.create_queue_item(...,{
    max_retries=1
})
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Setting Timeouts for Langfuse API Requests
DESCRIPTION: Examples of setting timeout values for Langfuse API requests. This demonstrates how to configure timeouts at both the client level and for individual API method calls.
SOURCE: https://github.com/langfuse/langfuse-python/blob/main/langfuse/api/README.md#2025-04-22_snippet_5

LANGUAGE: python
CODE:
```
from langfuse.client import FernLangfuse

client = FernLangfuse(..., { timeout=20.0 }, )


# Override timeout for a specific method
client.annotation_queues.create_queue_item(...,{
    timeout_in_seconds=1
})
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Installing Poetry Plugins for Development
DESCRIPTION: Commands to add required poetry plugins for development, including dotenv support and version bumping functionality.
SOURCE: https://github.com/langfuse/langfuse-python/blob/main/CONTRIBUTING.md#2025-04-22_snippet_0

LANGUAGE: bash
CODE:
```
poetry self add poetry-dotenv-plugin
poetry self add poetry-bumpversion
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Installing Project Dependencies with Poetry
DESCRIPTION: Command to install all project dependencies including optional extras using Poetry package manager.
SOURCE: https://github.com/langfuse/langfuse-python/blob/main/CONTRIBUTING.md#2025-04-22_snippet_1

LANGUAGE: bash
CODE:
```
poetry install --all-extras
```

TITLE: Setting Up Pre-commit Hooks
DESCRIPTION: Command to install pre-commit hooks for automated code quality checks before committing changes.
SOURCE: https://github.com/langfuse/langfuse-python/blob/main/CONTRIBUTING.md#2025-04-22_snippet_2

LANGUAGE: bash
CODE:
```
poetry run pre-commit install
```

TITLE: Running the Release Script
DESCRIPTION: Command to run the automated release script that handles version bumping, building, and publishing.
SOURCE: https://github.com/langfuse/langfuse-python/blob/main/CONTRIBUTING.md#2025-04-22_snippet_6

LANGUAGE: bash
CODE:

poetry run release

TITLE: Generating SDK Reference Documentation
DESCRIPTION: Command to generate SDK reference documentation using pdoc with custom formatting options and branding.
SOURCE: https://github.com/langfuse/langfuse-python/blob/main/CONTRIBUTING.md#2025-04-22_snippet_7

LANGUAGE: bash
CODE:
```
poetry run pdoc -o docs/ --docformat google --logo "https://langfuse.com/langfuse_logo.svg" langfuse
```
